channel.title: Converting pointers in c++ to c# equivilants

item.title: Converting pointers in c++ to c# equivilants
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

nvm I looked through some of the values in my code and found out a method isnt getting an address I need. i guess the modules is loaded for a little bit then it is disposed or something. idk but when I check for the modules address its not listed in the modules.

With this bit of c++;

DWORD pWepMgr = *(DWORD*)(CShell+WeaponMgr);

ok so am i wrong at thinking this basically says that the value produced will be the DWORD at the address CShell + WeaponMgr?

so would this be the same thing in c#;

ReadProcessMemory(hProcess, (IntPtr) CShell+WeaponMgr, buffer, 4, out bytesread);
uint pWepMgr = BitConverter.ToUInt32(buffer, 0);

if what i did is correct then why does it return 0 in c# but in c++ it has some value?

thanks. I was trying to figure out what I did wrong for literally 24 hrs yesterdayâ€¦

Read full topic
item.source: Converting pointers in c++ to c# equivilants
